intro: Cleome lateralis, commonly known as the spider flower, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the southern United States. It features slender, branching stems that often grow up to 2 to 3 feet tall, adorned with small, greenish-white flowers that resemble spiders. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Cleome lateralis thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
